intro: Meibomia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican meibomia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Meibomia costaricensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
